As a soft follow up to this morning... fantasy writers and role players alike, never ever ever forget: accommodations will always be accommodations.

If you use magic or scifi to create a utopia where disability doesnt exist because its all "cured", that is eugenics. Full stop.

There will always...

T H I S

Disability is the product of society, not an individual experience of the body.
Society creates disability through exclusion, it is a deliberate choice. Which means disability exists in all realities that involve humans, which means that disabled people exist in any fantasy environment

I think this is a great point 

Plus I think a lot of people conceive of disability as visible mobility issues or a lack of a specific sense like sight or hearing 

Systemic stuff isn’t on the average person’s radar

For the past 2.5 months, my disability case has been under review (standard periodic reevaluation). But whenever the review comes up, I'm always terrified they'll look at my case and say "Social anxiety disorder? You don't need disability for *that*" and take me off of it.

I have considered it and I don’t believe that you absolutely cannot leave.

You could find a work around to get money outside of your benefits. 

Anyone could.

And depending on your disability you can still fly.

There ARE solutions.

Disability advocate Imani Barbarin has talked a lot about this. Once the state decides you are disabled in this way, your rights are forfeit and they can basically warehouse you away--disrupting all your social relationships, any sources of income, and more. It can happen to anyone.
